titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to increase the primary insurance amounts of individuals who retire after attaining the age of 62, in or after 1979 (when the decoupling changes in the benefit formula became effective), in order to aid in eliminating the present disparity between the benefits payable to such individuals and the benefits payable to individuals similarly situated who retired before 1979.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary: 3/3/1987--Introduced. Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to increase the primary insurance amount for individuals who retire in or after 1979.
